title: UK construction in longest downturn since early 2020; global bond sell-off eases – business live
summary: UK construction activity is experiencing its longest continuous slump in five years, highlighting ongoing challenges in the sector. Despite this, long-term borrowing costs have dropped, providing a potential easing for future investments. Analysts are monitoring whether this decrease in borrowing costs will revive construction efforts in the coming months.

title: Adelaide v Collingwood: 2025 AFL first qualifying final – live
summary: The 2025 finals series kicks off in Adelaide with a match between the top two teams on the ladder. Martin Pegan provides goal-by-goal updates on the exciting matchup. Fans can stay tuned for live commentary and highlights throughout the game.

title: Macron says ‘Coalition of the Willing’ will finalise ‘robust’ Ukrainian security guarantees – Europe live
summary: Leaders meeting in Paris plan to communicate with Donald Trump this afternoon. The discussions may revolve around key global issues. This engagement highlights ongoing diplomatic efforts between the leaders and the former U.S. president.

title: Trump seeks to reverse ruling that his trade tariffs are illegal – US politics live
summary: The President is urging the Supreme Court to overturn a previous ruling declaring that many of his extensive trade tariffs were unlawful. This move seeks to reinstate the tariffs that were challenged in court. The outcome could significantly impact U.S. trade policy and relations.

title: Reeves has ‘full confidence’ in Rayner, and thinks deputy PM can keep her job – UK politics live
summary: The Chancellor has expressed strong support for a colleague amidst a recent stamp duty error. This backing emphasizes solidarity within the government despite the mistake. The incident highlights the challenges faced in fiscal policy management.
